title: Spring and Autumn period: The house of Zhao defeats the house of Zhi, ending the Battle of Jinyang, a military conflict between the elite families of the State of Jin.
text: Spring and Autumn period: The house of Zhao defeats the house of Zhi, ending the Battle of Jinyang, a military conflict between the elite families of the State of Jin.

title: Emperor Honorius signs an edict providing tax relief for the Italian provinces Tuscia, Campania, Picenum, Samnium, Apulia, Lucania and Calabria, which were plundered by the Visigoths.
text: Emperor Honorius signs an edict providing tax relief for the Italian provinces Tuscia, Campania, Picenum, Samnium, Apulia, Lucania and Calabria, which were plundered by the Visigoths.

title: Reccared I summons the Third Council of Toledo.
text: Reccared I summons the Third Council of Toledo.

title: Joan of Arc lifts the Siege of Orléans, turning the tide of the Hundred Years' War.
text: Joan of Arc lifts the Siege of Orléans, turning the tide of the Hundred Years' War.

title: Kentishmen revolt against King Henry VI.
text: Kentishmen revolt against King Henry VI.

title: A group of imperial guards, led by Trịnh Duy Sản, murdered Emperor Lê Tương Dực and fled, leaving the capital Thăng Long undefended.
text: A group of imperial guards, led by Trịnh Duy Sản, murdered Emperor Lê Tương Dực and fled, leaving the capital Thăng Long undefended.

title: Hernando de Soto reaches the Mississippi River and names it Río de Espíritu Santo.
text: Hernando de Soto reaches the Mississippi River and names it Río de Espíritu Santo.

title: King Louis XVI of France attempts to force through reforms by abolishing the parlements.
text: King Louis XVI of France attempts to force through reforms by abolishing the parlements.

title: Branded a traitor during the Reign of Terror, French chemist Antoine Lavoisier, who was also a tax collector with the Ferme générale, is tried, convicted and guillotined in one day in Paris.
text: Branded a traitor during the Reign of Terror, French chemist Antoine Lavoisier, who was also a tax collector with the Ferme générale, is tried, convicted and guillotined in one day in Paris.

title: Greek War of Independence: The Greeks defeat the Turks at the Battle of Gravia Inn.
text: Greek War of Independence: The Greeks defeat the Turks at the Battle of Gravia Inn.

title: A train derails and catches fire in Paris, killing between 52 and 200 people.
text: A train derails and catches fire in Paris, killing between 52 and 200 people.

title: Mexican–American War: Zachary Taylor defeats a Mexican force north of the Rio Grande in the first major battle of the war.
text: Mexican–American War: Zachary Taylor defeats a Mexican force north of the Rio Grande in the first major battle of the war.

title: At Gilmore's Gardens in New York City, the first Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show opens.
text: At Gilmore's Gardens in New York City, the first Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show opens.

title: Pharmacist John Pemberton first sells a carbonated beverage named "Coca-Cola" as a patent medicine.
text: Pharmacist John Pemberton first sells a carbonated beverage named "Coca-Cola" as a patent medicine.

title: The first games of the Italian football league system are played.
text: The first games of the Italian football league system are played.

title: The Irish Literary Theatre in Dublin produced its first play.
text: The Irish Literary Theatre in Dublin produced its first play.

title: In Martinique, Mount Pelée erupts, destroying the town of Saint-Pierre and killing over 30,000 people. Only a handful of residents survive the blast.
text: In Martinique, Mount Pelée erupts, destroying the town of Saint-Pierre and killing over 30,000 people. Only a handful of residents survive the blast.

title: Paramount Pictures is founded.
text: Paramount Pictures is founded.

title: Edward George Honey proposes the idea of a moment of silence to commemorate the Armistice of 11 November 1918 which ended World War I.
text: Edward George Honey proposes the idea of a moment of silence to commemorate the Armistice of 11 November 1918 which ended World War I.

title: The creation of the Communist Party of Romania.
text: The creation of the Communist Party of Romania.

title: The Klaipėda Convention is signed formally incorporating Klaipėda Region (Memel Territory) into Lithuania.
text: The Klaipėda Convention is signed formally incorporating Klaipėda Region (Memel Territory) into Lithuania.

title: Attempting to make the first non-stop transatlantic flight from Paris to New York, French war heroes Charles Nungesser and François Coli disappear after taking off aboard The White Bird biplane.
text: Attempting to make the first non-stop transatlantic flight from Paris to New York, French war heroes Charles Nungesser and François Coli disappear after taking off aboard The White Bird biplane.

title: Mohandas Gandhi begins a 21-day fast of self-purification and launched a one-year campaign to help the Harijan movement.
text: Mohandas Gandhi begins a 21-day fast of self-purification and launched a one-year campaign to help the Harijan movement.

title: World War II: The German Luftwaffe launches a bombing raid on Nottingham and Derby.
text: World War II: The German Luftwaffe launches a bombing raid on Nottingham and Derby.

title: World War II: The German 11th Army begins Operation Trappenjagd (Bustard Hunt) and destroys the bridgehead of the three Soviet armies defending the Kerch Peninsula.
text: World War II: The German 11th Army begins Operation Trappenjagd (Bustard Hunt) and destroys the bridgehead of the three Soviet armies defending the Kerch Peninsula.

title: World War II: The Battle of the Coral Sea comes to an end with Imperial Japanese Navy aircraft carrier aircraft attacking and sinking the United States Navy aircraft carrier USS Lexington.
text: World War II: The Battle of the Coral Sea comes to an end with Imperial Japanese Navy aircraft carrier aircraft attacking and sinking the United States Navy aircraft carrier USS Lexington.

title: World War II: Gunners of the Ceylon Garrison Artillery on Horsburgh Island in the Cocos Islands rebel in the Cocos Islands Mutiny. Their mutiny is crushed and three of them are executed, the only British Commonwealth soldiers to be executed for mutiny during the Second World War.
text: World War II: Gunners of the Ceylon Garrison Artillery on Horsburgh Island in the Cocos Islands rebel in the Cocos Islands Mutiny. Their mutiny is crushed and three of them are executed, the only British Commonwealth soldiers to be executed for mutiny during the Second World War.

title: World War II: German forces in the west agree to an unconditional surrender.
text: World War II: German forces in the west agree to an unconditional surrender.

title: End of the Prague uprising, celebrated now as a national holiday in the Czech Republic.
text: End of the Prague uprising, celebrated now as a national holiday in the Czech Republic.

title: Hundreds of Algerian civilians are killed by French Army soldiers in the Sétif massacre.
text: Hundreds of Algerian civilians are killed by French Army soldiers in the Sétif massacre.

title: The Halifax riot starts when thousands of civilians and servicemen rampage through Halifax, Nova Scotia.
text: The Halifax riot starts when thousands of civilians and servicemen rampage through Halifax, Nova Scotia.

title: Estonian schoolgirls Aili Jõgi and Ageeda Paavel blow up the Soviet memorial which stood in front of the Bronze Soldier of Tallinn.
text: Estonian schoolgirls Aili Jõgi and Ageeda Paavel blow up the Soviet memorial which stood in front of the Bronze Soldier of Tallinn.

title: South Vietnamese soldiers under the Roman Catholic President Ngo Dinh Diem open fire on Buddhists defying a ban on the flying of the Buddhist flag on Vesak, killing nine and sparking the Buddhist crisis.
text: South Vietnamese soldiers under the Roman Catholic President Ngo Dinh Diem open fire on Buddhists defying a ban on the flying of the Buddhist flag on Vesak, killing nine and sparking the Buddhist crisis.

title: The Philippine province of Davao is split into three: Davao del Norte, Davao del Sur, and Davao Oriental.
text: The Philippine province of Davao is split into three: Davao del Norte, Davao del Sur, and Davao Oriental.

title: Vietnam War: U.S. President Richard Nixon announces his order to place naval mines in major North Vietnamese ports in order to stem the flow of weapons and other goods to that nation.
text: Vietnam War: U.S. President Richard Nixon announces his order to place naval mines in major North Vietnamese ports in order to stem the flow of weapons and other goods to that nation.

title: A 71-day standoff between federal authorities and the American Indian Movement members occupying the Pine Ridge Reservation at Wounded Knee, South Dakota ends with the surrender of the militants.
text: A 71-day standoff between federal authorities and the American Indian Movement members occupying the Pine Ridge Reservation at Wounded Knee, South Dakota ends with the surrender of the militants.

title: The rollercoaster The New Revolution, the first steel coaster with a vertical loop, opens at Six Flags Magic Mountain.
text: The rollercoaster The New Revolution, the first steel coaster with a vertical loop, opens at Six Flags Magic Mountain.

title: The first ascent of Mount Everest without supplemental oxygen, by Reinhold Messner and Peter Habeler.
text: The first ascent of Mount Everest without supplemental oxygen, by Reinhold Messner and Peter Habeler.

title: The World Health Organization confirms the eradication of smallpox.
text: The World Health Organization confirms the eradication of smallpox.

title: Corporal Denis Lortie enters the Quebec National Assembly and opens fire, killing three people and wounding 13. René Jalbert, Sergeant-at-Arms of the Assembly, succeeds in calming him, for which he will later receive the Cross of Valour.
text: Corporal Denis Lortie enters the Quebec National Assembly and opens fire, killing three people and wounding 13. René Jalbert, Sergeant-at-Arms of the Assembly, succeeds in calming him, for which he will later receive the Cross of Valour.

title: The Thames Barrier is officially opened.
text: The Thames Barrier is officially opened.

title: The SAS kills eight Provisional Irish Republican Army volunteers and a civilian during an ambush in Loughgall, Northern Ireland.
text: The SAS kills eight Provisional Irish Republican Army volunteers and a civilian during an ambush in Loughgall, Northern Ireland.

title: A fire at Illinois Bell's Hinsdale Central Office triggers an extended 1AESS network outage once considered to be the "worst telecommunications disaster in US telephone industry history".
text: A fire at Illinois Bell's Hinsdale Central Office triggers an extended 1AESS network outage once considered to be the "worst telecommunications disaster in US telephone industry history".

title: China Southern Airlines Flight 3456 crashes on approach into Bao'an International Airport, killing 35 people.
